channel.title: Making Vista look like XP
channel.description:
I have an odd problem here. I was thinking last night that I loved the look of XP, much more than Vista. The blue task bar and the orange start button, all so smooth and diffuse.
So now I want that look. I figured finding a theme like that would be easy. Not really.
I found this: http://psycob.deviantart.com/art/Royale-for-Vista-Basic-67469153
That's pretty much what I want, although I don't like the shinyness that much.
So I have no idea what to do with it. The readme is very, bland.
It said I needed my uxtheme.dll etc patched, and I've done that.
And I'm guessing to install it you have to use the program it links to in the post. Well the link to that program is broke, and a quick google of the program leads to a lot of pages linking to the broken page. Back to square one I think.
I just keep finding a lot of people making XP look like Vista, not the other way around.
And the ones talking about Vista like XP, they just change a few personalization things and make it look like 98, all square and gray.
No I'm not downgrading, XP 64 wasn't good, and I don't think it'd be worth it in the end.
Any ideas?
EDIT: I found out how to get the theme working. But I still have questions. Anyone know how to make the theme lose the shinyness that is Vista? Or an XP theme that isn't shiny?

item.title: Making Vista look like XP
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I do not think so. But people have already started messing with themes for Windows 7, and doing some ports as well for the better ones from Vista.

Read full topic

That does not matter, you are the best graphics designer here anyway.

Is it possible to get Vista themes work on Windows 7?

Hes colorblind stop making fun of him[/quote]

item.title: Making Vista look like XP
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Ahh. The others were good but that one is sick Frell.

The only problem is the explorer windows don’t have titles on them =[

Also, I was thinking of editing one or something. Since I use the double-layered taskbar, it looks funny on these themes because the start button only works correctly when on a single-layered one. I was thinking of making a double-layered button that’s a square “green” thing like the single-layered one and putting that circular vista logo on it instead of the windows start thing. Kinda keep a little bit of vista, but XP, you know?

Read full topic

item.title: Making Vista look like XP
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I already said the classic theme is just like the 98 theme, blocky, and gray.

And I had already figured out how to install it.

Thank you bowser for answering me, that theme is like, perfect.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Vista look like XP
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Pretty simple.
In the package choose one of the folders. I would choose Royale_Candara since it is the nicest font. However if you prefer the others choose it!

Then in the WINDOWS directory there should be a folder called Resources and within that folder Themes.(C:\WINDOWS\Resources\Themes)

Now extract the folder of your choice in this folder and open it.
Click on Royale_Candara.msstyles and the apperance tab should open and you can select apply.

The directory is for XP, it might be different on Vista.
XP with a blue task bar has a green start button…

Read full topic

item.title: Making Vista look like XP
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:
